refs.BurnInDestinationSettings$FontSize: When set to 'auto' fontSize will scale depending on the size of the output.  Giving a positive integer will specify the exact font size in points.  All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
refs.CaptionDescription$CaptionSelectorName: Specifies which input caption selector to use as a caption source when generating output captions. This field should match a captionSelector name.
refs.CaptionDescription$LanguageDescription: Human readable information to indicate captions available for players (eg. English, or Spanish).
refs.CaptionDescription$Name: Name of the caption description.  Used to associate a caption description with an output.  Names must be unique within an event.
refs.CaptionSelector$LanguageCode: When specified this field indicates the three letter language code of the caption track to extract from the source.
refs.Channel$Arn: The unique arn of the channel.
refs.Channel$Id: The unique id of the channel.
refs.Channel$RoleArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role assumed when running the Channel.
refs.ChannelEgressEndpoint$SourceIp: Public IP of where a channel's output comes from
refs.ChannelSummary$Arn: The unique arn of the channel.
refs.ChannelSummary$Id: The unique id of the channel.
refs.ChannelSummary$RoleArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role assumed when running the Channel.
refs.CreateChannel$RequestId:
Unique request ID to be specified. This is needed to prevent retries from
creating multiple resources.
refs.CreateChannel$Reserved: Deprecated field that's only usable by whitelisted customers.
refs.CreateChannel$RoleArn: An optional Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume when running the Channel.
refs.CreateInput$RequestId:
Unique identifier of the request to ensure the request is handled
exactly once in case of retries.
refs.DvbSubDestinationSettings$FontSize: When set to auto fontSize will scale depending on the size of the output.  Giving a positive integer will specify the exact font size in points.  All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.
refs.FixedModeScheduleActionStartSettings$Tim: Start time for the action to start in the channel. (Not the time for the action to be added to the schedule: actions are always added to the schedule immediately.) UTC format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.nnnZ. All the letters are digits (for example, mm might be 01) except for the two constants "T" for time and "Z" for "UTC format".
refs.FollowModeScheduleActionStartSettings$Re: The action name of another action that this one refers to.
refs.HlsAkamaiSettings$Token: Token parameter for authenticated akamai. If not specified, _gda_ is used.
refs.HlsGroupSettings$BaseUrlContent: A partial URI prefix that will be prepended to each output in the media .m3u8 file. Can be used if base manifest is delivered from a different URL than the main .m3u8 file.
refs.HlsGroupSettings$BaseUrlManifest: A partial URI prefix that will be prepended to each output in the media .m3u8 file. Can be used if base manifest is delivered from a different URL than the main .m3u8 file.
refs.HlsGroupSettings$KeyFormat: The value specifies how the key is represented in the resource identified by the URI.  If parameter is absent, an implicit value of "identity" is used.  A reverse DNS string can also be given.
refs.HlsGroupSettings$KeyFormatVersions: Either a single positive integer version value or a slash delimited list of version values (1/2/3).
refs.HlsOutputSettings$SegmentModifier: String concatenated to end of segment filenames.
refs.Input$Arn: The Unique ARN of the input (generated, immutable).
refs.Input$Id: The generated ID of the input (unique for user account, immutable).
refs.Input$Name: The user-assigned name (This is a mutable value).
refs.InputAttachment$InputAttachmentName: User-specified name for the attachment. This is required if the user wants to use this input in an input switch action.
refs.InputDestination$Ip:
The system-generated static IP address of endpoint.
It remains fixed for the lifetime of the input.
refs.InputDestination$Port: The port number for the input.
refs.InputDestination$Url:
This represents the endpoint that the customer stream will be
pushed to.
refs.InputDestinationRequest$StreamName:
A unique name for the location the RTMP stream is being pushed
to.
refs.InputLocation$PasswordParam: key used to extract the password from EC2 Parameter store
refs.InputLocation$Uri: Uniform Resource Identifier - This should be a path to a file accessible to the Live system (eg. a http:// URI) depending on the output type. For example, a RTMP destination should have a uri simliar to: "rtmp://fmsserver/live".
refs.InputLocation$Username: Username if credentials are required to access a file or publishing point.  This can be either a plaintext username, or a reference to an AWS parameter store name from which the username can be retrieved.  AWS Parameter store format: "ssm://<parameter name>"
refs.InputSecurityGroup$Arn: Unique ARN of Input Security Group
refs.InputSecurityGroup$Id: The Id of the Input Security Group
refs.InputSource$PasswordParam: The key used to extract the password from EC2 Parameter store.
refs.InputSource$Url:
This represents the customer's source URL where stream is
pulled from.
refs.InputSource$Username: The username for the input source.
refs.InputSourceRequest$PasswordParam: The key used to extract the password from EC2 Parameter store.
refs.InputSourceRequest$Url:
This represents the customer's source URL where stream is
pulled from.
refs.InputSourceRequest$Username: The username for the input source.
refs.InputSwitchScheduleActionSettings$InputA: The name of the input attachment that should be switched to by this action.
refs.ListOfferingsResultModel$NextToken: Token to retrieve the next page of results
refs.ListReservationsResultModel$NextToken: Token to retrieve the next page of results
refs.M2tsSettings$AribCaptionsPid: Packet Identifier (PID) for ARIB Captions in the transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.  Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
refs.M2tsSettings$AudioPids: Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary audio stream(s) in the transport stream. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values. Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
refs.M2tsSettings$DvbSubPids: Packet Identifier (PID) for input source DVB Subtitle data to this output. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values.  Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
refs.M2tsSettings$DvbTeletextPid: Packet Identifier (PID) for input source DVB Teletext data to this output. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.  Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
refs.M2tsSettings$EcmPid: This field is unused and deprecated.
refs.M2tsSettings$EtvPlatformPid: Packet Identifier (PID) for input source ETV Platform data to this output. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.  Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
refs.M2tsSettings$EtvSignalPid: Packet Identifier (PID) for input source ETV Signal data to this output. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.  Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
refs.M2tsSettings$KlvDataPids: Packet Identifier (PID) for input source KLV data to this output. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values.  Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
refs.M2tsSettings$PcrPid: Packet Identifier (PID) of the Program Clock Reference (PCR) in the transport stream. When no value is given, the encoder will assign the same value as the Video PID. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.  Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
refs.M2tsSettings$PmtPid: Packet Identifier (PID) for the Program Map Table (PMT) in the transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value. Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
refs.M2tsSettings$Scte27Pids: Packet Identifier (PID) for input source SCTE-27 data to this output. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values.  Each PID specified must be in the range of 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
refs.M2tsSettings$Scte35Pid: Packet Identifier (PID) of the SCTE-35 stream in the transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.  Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
refs.M2tsSettings$TimedMetadataPid: Packet Identifier (PID) of the timed metadata stream in the transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.  Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
refs.M2tsSettings$VideoPid: Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary video stream in the transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.  Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
refs.M3u8Settings$AudioPids: Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary audio stream(s) in the transport stream. Multiple values are accepted, and can be entered in ranges and/or by comma separation. Can be entered as decimal or hexadecimal values.
refs.M3u8Settings$EcmPid: This parameter is unused and deprecated.
refs.M3u8Settings$PcrPid: Packet Identifier (PID) of the Program Clock Reference (PCR) in the transport stream. When no value is given, the encoder will assign the same value as the Video PID. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
refs.M3u8Settings$PmtPid: Packet Identifier (PID) for the Program Map Table (PMT) in the transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
refs.M3u8Settings$Scte35Pid: Packet Identifier (PID) of the SCTE-35 stream in the transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
refs.M3u8Settings$TimedMetadataPid: Packet Identifier (PID) of the timed metadata stream in the transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.  Valid values are 32 (or 0x20)..8182 (or 0x1ff6).
refs.M3u8Settings$VideoPid: Packet Identifier (PID) of the elementary video stream in the transport stream. Can be entered as a decimal or hexadecimal value.
refs.MsSmoothGroupSettings$AcquisitionPointId: The value of the "Acquisition Point Identity" element used in each message placed in the sparse track.  Only enabled if sparseTrackType is not "none".
refs.MsSmoothGroupSettings$EventId:
MS Smooth event ID to be sent to the IIS server.

Should only be specified if eventIdMode is set to useConfigured.
refs.MsSmoothGroupSettings$TimestampOffset: Timestamp offset for the event.  Only used if timestampOffsetMode is set to useConfiguredOffset.
refs.MsSmoothOutputSettings$NameModifier: String concatenated to the end of the destination filename.  Required for multiple outputs of the same type.
refs.Offering$CurrencyCode: Currency code for usagePrice and fixedPrice in ISO-4217 format, e.g. 'USD'
refs.Offering$OfferingDescription: Offering description, e.g. 'HD AVC output at 10-20 Mbps, 30 fps, and standard VQ in US West (Oregon)'
refs.Output$VideoDescriptionName: The name of the VideoDescription used as the source for this output.
refs.OutputDestination$Id: User-specified id. This is used in an output group or an output.
refs.OutputDestinationSettings$PasswordParam: key used to extract the password from EC2 Parameter store
refs.OutputDestinationSettings$StreamName: Stream name for RTMP destinations (URLs of type rtmp://)
refs.PurchaseOffering$RequestId: Unique request ID to be specified. This is needed to prevent retries from creating multiple resources.
refs.PurchaseOffering$Start: Requested reservation start time (UTC) in ISO-8601 format. The specified time must be between the first day of the current month and one year from now. If no value is given, the default is now.
refs.Reservation$CurrencyCode: Currency code for usagePrice and fixedPrice in ISO-4217 format, e.g. 'USD'
refs.Reservation$End: Reservation UTC end date and time in ISO-8601 format, e.g. '2019-03-01T00:00:00'
refs.Reservation$OfferingDescription: Offering description, e.g. 'HD AVC output at 10-20 Mbps, 30 fps, and standard VQ in US West (Oregon)'
refs.Reservation$Start: Reservation UTC start date and time in ISO-8601 format, e.g. '2018-03-01T00:00:00'
refs.ScheduleAction$ActionName: The name of the action, must be unique within the schedule. This name provides the main reference to an action once it is added to the schedule. A name is unique if it is no longer in the schedule. The schedule is automatically cleaned up to remove actions with a start time of more than 1 hour ago (approximately) so at that point a name can be reused.
refs.ScheduleDescribeResultModel$NextToken: The next token; for use in pagination.
refs.Scte35SegmentationDescriptor$Segmentatio: Corresponds to SCTE-35 segmentation_upid. Enter a string containing the hexadecimal representation of the characters that make up the SCTE-35 segmentation_upid value. Must contain an even number of hex characters. Do not include spaces between each hex pair. For example, the ASCII "ADS Information" becomes hex "41445320496e666f726d6174696f6e.
refs.StandardHlsSettings$AudioRenditionSets: List all the audio groups that are used with the video output stream. Input all the audio GROUP-IDs that are associated to the video, separate by ','.
refs.TeletextSourceSettings$PageNumber: Specifies the teletext page number within the data stream from which to extract captions. Range of 0x100 (256) to 0x8FF (2303). Unused for passthrough. Should be specified as a hexadecimal string with no "0x" prefix.
refs.UpdateChannel$RoleArn: An optional Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role to assume when running the Channel. If you do not specify this on an update call but the role was previously set that role will be removed.
refs.VideoDescription$Name: The name of this VideoDescription. Outputs will use this name to uniquely identify this Description.  Description names should be unique within this Live Event.

refs.OutputGroup$Name: Custom output group name optionally defined by the user.  Only letters, numbers, and the underscore character allowed; only 32 characters allowed.

refs.AudioSelector$Name: The name of this AudioSelector. AudioDescriptions will use this name to uniquely identify this Selector.  Selector names should be unique per input.
refs.CaptionSelector$Name: Name identifier for a caption selector.  This name is used to associate this caption selector with one or more caption descriptions.  Names must be unique within an event.
refs.HlsOutputSettings$NameModifier: String concatenated to the end of the destination filename. Accepts \"Format Identifiers\":#formatIdentifierParameters.

refs.Output$OutputName: The name used to identify an output.

refs.DvbNitSettings$NetworkName: The network name text placed in the networkNameDescriptor inside the Network Information Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.
refs.DvbSdtSettings$ServiceName: The service name placed in the serviceDescriptor in the Service Description Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.
refs.DvbSdtSettings$ServiceProviderName: The service provider name placed in the serviceDescriptor in the Service Description Table. Maximum length is 256 characters.

refs.HlsGroupSettings$ConstantIv: For use with encryptionType. This is a 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character text string. If ivSource is set to "explicit" then this parameter is required and is used as the IV for encryption.
refs.StaticKeySettings$StaticKeyValue: Static key value as a 32 character hexadecimal string.

refs.BlackoutSlate$NetworkId: Provides Network ID that matches EIDR ID format (e.g., "10.XXXX/XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-C").

refs.AudioDescription$LanguageCode: Indicates the language of the audio output track. Only used if languageControlMode is useConfigured, or there is no ISO 639 language code specified in the input.
refs.CaptionLanguageMapping$LanguageCode: Three character ISO 639-2 language code (see http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2)

refs.InputLossBehavior$InputLossImageColor: When input loss image type is "color" this field specifies the color to use. Value: 6 hex characters representing the values of RGB.
